Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s 1968 Night of the Living Dead spawned the full-feature zombie craze in the 1970s, including popular theatrical classics such as The Living Dead at the Manchester Morgue, Zombie, Dawn of the Dead and The Return of the Living Dead.

The US — a land where anyone from anywhere can pick up their spatula for debate and comment publicly on any topic of their liking — and The Dutch — a tightly knit society where one must be related by blood, word or deed before being qualified to develop a concurred opinion without first having gone through a rigorous vaccination program of insult

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to Polish director Djolaidas.
But there are so many characters attempting their own obsessions and complicated histories - and Djolaidas seems to have difficulty distinguishing between narrative strands here, that I found myself completely lost, no idea what was going on.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all over the place and several skeletons and bodies half eaten. So what are they going to do next? Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to Kingdom of Heaven .
The first thing we see is a castle, flooded by light, and a parody of itself, this castle with its exterior design whose inner is so different we start wondering : will the movie make us participants in the shooting and see the back of this television show ?

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is the first of three AVCO Embassy productions with the Phoenix Motion Picture Company based on the TV series.
